subject: Fix volume lookups in SolidFire template caching
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-12 00:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/test_solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/be47dce89451da49686e05dbf4c273d6cd1d8577', 'message': "Fix volume lookups in SolidFire template caching

There's a number of issues with the SolidFire template caching
code.  There are a number of metadata items that aren't consistent
between Glance API V1 and V2, there's also some problems with how
the code is dealing with it's internal volume and just flat out
wrong account checking.

This patch focuses mainly on fixing up the account and volumeID
issues.  The _do_clone method currently expects to find the src
volume under the same account as the dest volume.  That's fine
for most cases, but doesn't work for either the SolidFire template
caching, or for the use of generic image caching in Cinder.

We fix that easily by modifying the _get_sf_volume call to have an
option to search all active volumes on the Cluster instead of just
those for a specified account.  For now we only change the clone
methods, as they're the only case where we fall into the case of
cross-ownership of volumes in the same context.

The other issue is around the cleanup/delete in the case of a
failed template-volume create.  In this case we were passing in
the Cinder UUID to a direct SolidFire API delete cmd, which
is wrong.  The direct call for the SolidFire API call requires
that the actual SolidFire ID be used.  So we leverage the modified
_get_sf_volume call here as well.

Another issue that was introduced was the introduction of
a connector object to the intialize_connection call.  We
got around this once already by just passing in a fake
connector that was actually a string.  That was fine, but
the initialize_connection routine also now checks the connector
for multi_attach, so it fails the _get call on a string.  We
fix that by just building a dict and using that instead of
a fake string.

Finally, the method of relying on the Glance metadata virt size
has been problematic, it's not set by default, it's not accurate
and it's a bit inefficient.  There have been a number of issues
with this method of size determination, so we'll dump that and
just leverage the image_utils methods directly.

Closes-Bug: #1494830
Closes-Bug: #1494927
(cherry picked from commit 809567661d6732eaf4a5e77d2f2df07621ee5114)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/test_solidfire.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py

Change-Id: Icfd6668389049d3d5686acdb832847aa2d2fce52
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volume lookups in SolidFire template caching

There's a number of issues with the SolidFire template caching
code.  There are a number of metadata items that aren't consistent
between Glance API V1 and V2, there's also some problems with how
the code is dealing with it's internal volume and just flat out
wrong account checking.

This patch focuses mainly on fixing up the account and volumeID
issues.  The _do_clone method currently expects to find the src
volume under the same account as the dest volume.  That's fine
for most cases, but doesn't work for either the SolidFire template
caching, or for the use of generic image caching in Cinder.

We fix that easily by modifying the _get_sf_volume call to have an
option to search all active volumes on the Cluster instead of just
those for a specified account.  For now we only change the clone
methods, as they're the only case where we fall into the case of
cross-ownership of volumes in the same context.

The other issue is around the cleanup/delete in the case of a
failed template-volume create.  In this case we were passing in
the Cinder UUID to a direct SolidFire API delete cmd, which
is wrong.  The direct call for the SolidFire API call requires
that the actual SolidFire ID be used.  So we leverage the modified
_get_sf_volume call here as well.

Another issue that was introduced was the introduction of
a connector object to the intialize_connection call.  We
got around this once already by just passing in a fake
connector that was actually a string.  That was fine, but
the initialize_connection routine also now checks the connector
for multi_attach, so it fails the _get call on a string.  We
fix that by just building a dict and using that instead of
a fake string.

Finally, the method of relying on the Glance metadata virt size
has been problematic, it's not set by default, it's not accurate
and it's a bit inefficient.  There have been a number of issues
with this method of size determination, so we'll dump that and
just leverage the image_utils methods directly.

Closes-Bug: #1494830
Closes-Bug: #1494927
(cherry picked from commit 809567661d6732eaf4a5e77d2f2df07621ee5114)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/test_solidfire.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py

Change-Id: Icfd6668389049d3d5686acdb832847aa2d2fce52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/93/256893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: ML2: Call _dict_extend in create_(net|port) ops
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 11:02:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/063e7b33ea4eb2ef70b80f66faa7419edfe47cc4', 'message': "ML2: Call _dict_extend in create_(net|port) ops

The extensions fields were not being added to the response being
sent back to the user for ports and networks that weren't from
ML2 extensions (e.g. availability zones). This created an
inconsistent response between creates and updates/gets. It also
resulted in incomplete data in the AMQP create notification emitted
in the API layer.

This patch adjusts ML2 to call the _apply_dict_extend_functions
method after creating ports and networks. To make this work, another
DB lookup to get the latest model state was necessary. However, this
is part of an already expensive operation (create) so the performance
impact should be minimal.

This issue stems from the fact that db_base_plugin_v2 does not
process extensions when its create_port, create_network methods
are called. This original skipping behavior was added back in
patch If0f0277191884aab4dcb1ee36826df7f7d66a8fa as a performance
improvement to deal with dictionary extension functions that
performed DB lookups. However, at this point the dictionary
extension functions should have been optimized to skip any DB
lookups to avoid the massive performance penalties they incur
during list operations.

An alternative to this patch was to adjust the db_base_plugin_v2
to stop skipping extensions. However, because this is usually
called by inheriting plugins before they process extensions
for the new port/network, the extensions do not yet have the
required information to extend the dict and will fail. So each
core plugin will need to apply similar logic to support extensions
that rely on the extend_dict functions.

Conflicts:
        neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_availability_zone.py
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_extension_driver_api.py

Closes-Bug: #1541774
Change-Id: Iea2c0e7f9ee5eeae28b99797874ca8a8e5790ec2
"}]
commit_message:
ML2: Call _dict_extend in create_(net|port) ops

The extensions fields were not being added to the response being
sent back to the user for ports and networks that weren't from
ML2 extensions (e.g. availability zones). This created an
inconsistent response between creates and updates/gets. It also
resulted in incomplete data in the AMQP create notification emitted
in the API layer.

This patch adjusts ML2 to call the _apply_dict_extend_functions
method after creating ports and networks. To make this work, another
DB lookup to get the latest model state was necessary. However, this
is part of an already expensive operation (create) so the performance
impact should be minimal.

This issue stems from the fact that db_base_plugin_v2 does not
process extensions when its create_port, create_network methods
are called. This original skipping behavior was added back in
patch If0f0277191884aab4dcb1ee36826df7f7d66a8fa as a performance
improvement to deal with dictionary extension functions that
performed DB lookups. However, at this point the dictionary
extension functions should have been optimized to skip any DB
lookups to avoid the massive performance penalties they incur
during list operations.

An alternative to this patch was to adjust the db_base_plugin_v2
to stop skipping extensions. However, because this is usually
called by inheriting plugins before they process extensions
for the new port/network, the extensions do not yet have the
required information to extend the dict and will fail. So each
core plugin will need to apply similar logic to support extensions
that rely on the extend_dict functions.

Conflicts:
        neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_availability_zone.py
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_extension_driver_api.py

Closes-Bug: #1541774
Change-Id: Iea2c0e7f9ee5eeae28b99797874ca8a8e5790ec2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/297021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(kevinbenton): this extra lookup is necessary to get the # latest db model for the extension functions net_model = self._get_network(context, result['id']) self._apply_dict_extend_functions('networks', result, net_model) # NOTE(kevinbenton): this extra lookup is necessary to get the # latest db model for the extension functions port_model = self._get_port(context, result['id']) self._apply_dict_extend_functions('ports', result, port_model)

commit_message:
Nova-compute connects to all of the iscsi target

Nova-compute tries to connect to all of the
iscsi target which discovered when using
multhpath in Kilo.
As a result , a lot of unnecessary sessions
occur on the nova-compute.

We have to choose correct targets from
output of iscsiadm discovery by
iqn of the volume we try to connect.

Closes-Bug: #1562665
Change-Id: I4dd25b92a418569af03609c6052ffa21d2a8a556

commit_message:
Do not pass auth token into virtual media floppy

Deploy ramdisk in agent based drivers uses lookup and heartbeat which
are part of public ACL. Auth token is not required to be passed into
virtual media floppy during deploy for agent_ilo driver.

Reason to backport:
Passing auth token unnecessarily for the APIs where it is not
required could cause security issue depending on the deploy setup.

(cherry picked from commit Ice85ae4bb84d2f7c53759264812e5fbc29ac510f)

The cherry-picked commit Ice85ae4bb84d2f7c53759264812e5fbc29ac510f
removes auth token for both iscsi_ilo and agent_ilo drivers as all
the vendorpassthru methods called by deploy ramdisk are changed to
public ACL.
In Kilo branch only lookup and heartbeat methods are into
public ACL list. The code for preparing floppy image is common to
both iscsi_ilo and agent_ilo drivers.
The cherry-picked commit has been modified to ensure that auth token
is passed to virtual media floppy image only when it is being called
for iscsi_ilo driver.

Closes-Bug: #1518560
Change-Id: I1791bbe32021b61eb129665c319a871c62df7605
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/65/248365/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pass insecure and ca_certificate option for cfn transport

This fix passes the insecure and ca_certificate option to the
os-collect-config.conf for the cfn transport.

commit_message:
Allow filtering using unicode characters

Current code forces the filter arguments to be converted
to a byte string using str() which prevents filtering
using unicode characters. This patch fixes that.

Co-Authored-By: Luo Gangyi <luogangyi@chinamobile.com>
Change-Id: I3abef5da4c2614806011440a4443e869920b4afd
Partial-Bug: 1472999
(cherry picked from commit 1c003473353a511142b30ade1aa92f6fb1633e45)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/01/249101/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix logic for checking if az can be updated

The existing logic was overly complicated and missed out on those hosts
whose services were disabled.

This is a complete rewrite that makes use of a single aggregate query,
thereby bypassing a lot of the extra logic needed by the old code.

Fixes an issue in objects.AggregateList.get_by_metadata_key() where
filtering by an empty list of hosts will return metadata for all hosts.

Also removes a call to db.aggregate_metadata_get_by_metadata_key() to
avoid the need for special handling due to that method returning
metadata as sets of values instead of strings and also because the same
metadata is already fetched in another method.

Change-Id: I514e63ce863f2c77dcd47af3e3674019033a77de
Closes-Bug: #1419115
(cherry picked from commit e35c6761132e1abfea70ec1283891660451ec556)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/239274/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: host_aggregates = objects.AggregateList.get_by_metadata_key( context, 'availability_zone', hosts=_hosts) conflicting_azs = [ agg.availability_zone for agg in host_aggregates if agg.availability_zone != metadata['availability_zone'] and agg.id != aggregate.id] if conflicting_azs: msg = _("One or more hosts already in availability zone(s) " "%s") % conflicting_azs self._raise_invalid_aggregate_exc(action_name, aggregate.id, msg) self.is_safe_to_update_az(context, aggregate.metadata, hosts=[host_name], aggregate=aggregate)
deleted_lines: zones, not_zones = availability_zones.get_availability_zones( context, with_hosts=True) for host in _hosts: # NOTE(sbauza): Host can only be in one AZ, so let's take only # the first element host_azs = [az for (az, az_hosts) in zones if host in az_hosts and az != CONF.internal_service_availability_zone] host_az = host_azs.pop() if host_azs: LOG.warning(_LW("More than 1 AZ for host %s"), host) if host_az == CONF.default_availability_zone: # NOTE(sbauza): Aggregate with AZ set to default AZ can # exist, we need to check host_aggs = objects.AggregateList.get_by_host( context, host, key='availability_zone') default_aggs = [agg for agg in host_aggs if agg['metadata'].get( 'availability_zone' ) == CONF.default_availability_zone] else: default_aggs = [] if (host_az != aggregate.metadata.get('availability_zone') and (host_az != CONF.default_availability_zone or len(default_aggs) != 0)): self._check_az_for_host( metadata, host_az, aggregate.id, action_name=action_name) def _check_az_for_host(self, aggregate_meta, host_az, aggregate_id, action_name=AGGREGATE_ACTION_ADD): # NOTE(mtreinish) The availability_zone key returns a set of # zones so loop over each zone. However there should only # ever be one zone in the set because an aggregate can only # have a single availability zone set at one time. if isinstance(aggregate_meta["availability_zone"], six.string_types): azs = set([aggregate_meta["availability_zone"]]) else: azs = aggregate_meta["availability_zone"] for aggregate_az in azs: # NOTE(mtreinish) Ensure that the aggregate_az is not none # if it is none then that is just a regular aggregate and # it is valid to have a host in multiple aggregates. if aggregate_az and aggregate_az != host_az: msg = _("Host already in availability zone " "%s") % host_az self._raise_invalid_aggregate_exc(action_name, aggregate_id, msg) metadata = self.db.aggregate_metadata_get_by_metadata_key( context, aggregate_id, 'availability_zone') self.is_safe_to_update_az(context, metadata, hosts=[host_name], aggregate=aggregate)

subject: Ignore Cinder error when shutdown instance

commit_message:
Ignore Cinder error when shutdown instance

Ignore cinder errors when doing shutdown, thus we will continue
the cleanup even if some exceptions there, so we won't get
a couple of instance which can't be deleted

Change-Id: I3c7202524857e2205b2442bbbcce9468cb2172c3
Closes-Bug: 1450658
(cherry picked from commit e6d700b0d26c3ede357331add58f2037cb565a0f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/256239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except cinder_exception.ClientException as exc: LOG.warning(_LW('Ignoring Unknown cinder exception: %s'), exc, instance=instance)

commit_message:
Update iLO driver documentation for configuring Swift

This commit updates iLO driver documentation to reflect
that HTTPS has to enabled in Swift explicitly to encrypt
the communication with Swift for Ironic Conductor and
iLO.

Change-Id: I12d278f63474814f5c2b6df339004d700a697a1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/03/219603/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Users who have concerns on PXE driver's security issues and want to have a security enhanced PXE-less deployment mechanism. The PXE driver passes management info in clear-text to the baremetal node. However, if Swift proxy server has an HTTPS endpoint (See `Enabling HTTPS in Swift`_ for more information), the ``iscsi_ilo`` driver driver provides enhanced security by passing authtoken and management info over encrypted management network. (Virtual Media) if Swift proxy server has an HTTPS endpoint. See `Enabling HTTPS in Swift`_ for more info. Provisioning is done using iSCSI over data network (like PXE driver), so this driver has the benefit of security enhancement with the same performance. Hence it segregates management info from data channel.Enabling HTTPS in Swift ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ iLO drivers ``iscsi_ilo`` and ``agent_ilo`` use Swift for storing boot images and management information. By default, HTTPS is not enabled in Swift. HTTPS is required to encrypt all communication between Swift and Ironic conductor and Swift and bare metal (via Virtual Media). It can be enabled in one of the following ways: * Using an SSL termination proxy. For more information, refer to http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/content/tls-proxies-and-http-services.html * Using native SSL support in Swift (recommended only for testing purpose). + Create self-signed cert for SSL using the following commands:: cd /etc/swift openssl req -new -x509 -nodes -out cert.crt -keyout cert.key + Add the following lines to /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf under [DEFAULT]:: bind_port = 443 cert_file = /etc/swift/cert.crt key_file = /etc/swift/cert.key + Restart the Swift proxy server.
deleted_lines: * Current PXE driver passes authentication token in clear-text over tftp to the baremetal node. ``iscsi_ilo`` driver enhances the security by passing keystone authtoken and management info over encrypted management network. This driver may be used by users who have concerns on PXE drivers security issues and want to have a security enhanced PXE-less deployment mechanism. (Virtual Media). Provisioning is done using iSCSI over data network (like PXE driver), so this driver has the benefit of security enhancement with the same performance. Hence it segregates management info from data channel.

commit_message:
Resolve arguments to 'repeat' function at runtime

This fixes a regression caused by a7c4b2332f9d1accaa89b51fbc3b09014995983a
in evaluating the 'for_each' argument too early (at parse time - before the
result of runtime functions like get_attr are available), while preserving
the fix for bug 1466748 in allowing intrinsic functions to be used in the
argument.

Change-Id: If1e9c754ef372de2f7edd32a9a8247eb271c5871
Closes-Bug: #1553306
Related-Bug: #1466748
(cherry picked from commit bf60398c906b3140553976513e9f08ecc44433c8)

commit_message:
Update $IMAGE_ELEMENT after excluding elements

The $IMAGE_ELEMENT environment variable should be updated after
processing excluded elements so that it's value is the accurate list of
elements included in the instack run. Some elements rely on this
environment variable (such as package-installs).

blueprint undercloud-elements
Closes-Bug: 1578357

Change-Id: I96afd9476eda05638ef631f225b216374586a386
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack refs/changes/09/312709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/72/313672/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. NOTE:: As of now we only support config overrides for ini based configs. Kolla allows deployer to override configuration of services. Kolla will look for file in /etc/kolla/config/<< sevice name >>/<< config file >>. This can be done per-project, per-service or per-service-on-specified-host. For example to override scheduler_max_attempts in nova scheduler, you need to create /etc/kolla/config/nova/nova-scheduler.conf with content: :: [DEFAULT] scheduler_max_attempts = 100 If you want to configure compute node ram allocation ratio on host myhost, you need to create file /etc/kolla/config/nova/myhost/nova.conf with content: :: [DEFAULT] ram_allocation_ratio = 5.0
deleted_lines: Advanced ConfigurationTODO(all) fill this section out

commit_message:
Add missing files to the install script

In order for Kuryr's libnetwork driver to function, it is essential
that /usr/libexec, the driver specfile and /etc/kuryr get installed.
Up until now, this was manual. This change fixes it.

Change-Id: Ifdb6048a154aa811a0369cbcdb848b19798bc51f
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <toni@midokura.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/07/312907/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KURYR_CONFIG_SAMPLE=${KURYR_CONFIG_DIR}/${KURYR_CONFIG_FILENAME}.sample
deleted_lines: KURYR_ACTIVATOR_FILENAME=kuryr.spec KURYR_DEFAULT_ACTIVATOR=${KURYR_HOME}/etc/${KURYR_ACTIVATOR_FILENAME}# See libnetwork's plugin discovery mechanism: # https://github.com/docker/docker/blob/c4d45b6a29a91f2fb5d7a51ac36572f2a9b295c6/docs/extend/plugin_api.md#plugin-discovery KURYR_ACTIVATOR_DIR=${KURYR_ACTIVATOR_DIR:-/usr/lib/docker/plugins/kuryr} KURYR_ACTIVATOR=${KURYR_ACTIVATOR_DIR}/${KURYR_ACTIVATOR_FILENAME} KURYR_DEFAULT_CONFIG=${KURYR_HOME}/etc/${KURYR_CONFIG_FILENAME}

commit_message:
Fixed parameter name for ControllerExtraConfig

Includes a note how to migrate deployments which made use of
`controllerExtraConfig`.

Change-Id: I326097dd0d6f2339c3fec561f5386d8370b4f596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/60/308860/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * `ControllerExtraConfig`: Apply the data only to Controller nodes Previously the parameter for Controller nodes was named `controllerExtraConfig` (note the inconsistent capitalization). If you are updating a deployment which used the old parameter, all values previously passed to `controllerExtraConfig` should be passed to `ControllerExtraConfig` instead, and `controllerExtraConfig: {}` should be explicitly set in `parameter_defaults`, to ensure that values from the old parameter will not be used anymore. .. note::
deleted_lines: * `controllerExtraConfig`: Apply the data only to Controller nodes *(note the inconsistent capitalization...)*

commit_message:
Remove legacy v2 tests which use APIRouter

APIRouter is only for leagacy v2 API, and the router should be
removed with legacy v2 API code together.
Then this patch removes tests which use the router.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: I7c15f53cfee46fcc0862753e490d675d2f5dd87f

commit_message:
[Checkpoints] Add delete action

Change-Id: I294dee59cacf936ca96b434abe5b5a5ac8b841ef
Closes-Bug: #1578904
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor-dashboard refs/changes/17/313217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.translation import ungettext_lazyfrom smaug_dashboard.api import smaug as smaugclient class DeleteCheckpointsAction(tables.DeleteAction): @staticmethod def action_present(count): return ungettext_lazy(u"Delete Checkpoint", u"Delete Checkpoints", count) @staticmethod def action_past(count): return ungettext_lazy(u"Deleted Checkpoint", u"Deleted Checkpoints", count) def allowed(self, request, checkpoint): return True def delete(self, request, obj_id): datum = self.table.get_object_by_id(obj_id) provider_id = datum.provider_id smaugclient.checkpoint_delete(request, provider_id=provider_id, checkpoint_id=obj_id) row_actions = (DeleteCheckpointsAction,)

commit_message:
fix opts.list_opts for polling options

After running `tox -egenconfig`, in etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf,
batch_polled_samples & shuffle_time_before_polling_task appears
for three times, while partitioning_group_prefix doesn't show up.

This is because we specify those options in a wrong way in
``opts.list_opts``, for partitioning_group_prefix, it is a typo
which reference the wrong option list, while for the rest two,
we should not add them to list_opt and comment they are deprecated,
oslo.config has already provided a field named deprecated_group.

This patch corrects them into the proper place.

Change-Id: I88c475aab1b76b38cadaa4275907443880464948
Closes-Bug: #1579089

commit_message:
Add tox test for k8s coreos bay

* Add a CoreOS test class TestCoreosKubernetesAPIs
* Add a CoreOS test environment in tox.ini
* Create a base class BaseK8sTest and move OS-agnostic k8s testing
  code to that class.
* Increase the disk size from 8G to 10G for m1.magnum and s1.magnum,
  since CoreOS image requires more disk space to boot.
* Set os-distro property for CoreOS image.

Partial-Bug: #1546101
Change-Id: Ie56a9442ecebe05f39c7669bc950f5a6ca11df33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/53/285853/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparsefrom nova.console import type as console_type def get_serial_console(self, context, instance): """Override the super class method""" try: node = self._validate_instance_and_node(instance) console = self.ironicclient.call('node.get_console', node.uuid) console_info = console['console_info'] if console_info['type'] == 'ipmiproxy': # For 'ipmiproxy' console, use the url url = console_info['url'] else: # For other consoles, try to find the 'ipmiproxy' param # If not found, then the console doesn't have 'ipmiproxy' # support url = console_info['ipmiproxy'] parsed_url = urlparse.urlparse(url, "") if parsed_url.scheme in ("tcp", "tcp6"): return console_type.ConsoleSerial(host=parsed_url.hostname, port=parsed_url.port) except Exception as ex: LOG.warning(_LW('Failed to get serial console from Ironic ' 'for instance %(inst)s. Reason: %(reason)s') % {'inst': instance.uuid, 'reason': six.text_type(ex)}) raise exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable(console_type='serial')

commit_message:
[WIP] Implement the IPMIProxy server

- Adds implementation for the proxy server
- Adds console_utils functions
- Unit tests will be added later

Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/296869/

Change-Id: I47ab36d27df087f2c2f7a67a2e075e124763e464
Partial-Bug: #1553083
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/94/303894/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 FUJITSU LIMITED # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ IPMI proxy that is compatible with OpenStack Nova Serial console. """ import json from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging import requests import requests.api from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth import six from ironic.common import exception from ironic.common.i18n import _ LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_opt('my_ip', 'ironic.netconf') ipmiproxy_opts = [ cfg.BoolOpt('proxy_supported', default=True, help=_('Whether support the proxy in some existing ' 'console drivers such as IPMIShellinaboxConsole or' 'NativeIPMIShellinaboxConsole')), cfg.StrOpt('proxy_address', default='$my_ip', help=_('Address of the host the proxy runs on')), cfg.IntOpt('proxy_admin_port', default=9999, help=_('Admin port the proxy listens at to receive ' 'control messages from Ironic conductor')), cfg.StrOpt('proxy_auth_key', default='ironic', help=_('Authentication key Ironic conductor uses when ' 'connects to the proxy')), cfg.StrOpt('proxy_cert_file', default=None, help=_('Certificate file to run the proxy securely')), cfg.StrOpt('proxy_key_file', default=None, help=_('Private key file to run the proxy securely')), cfg.StrOpt('proxy_ca_file', default=None, help=_('CA bundle file Ironic conductor uses when connects ' 'to the proxy')), cfg.IntOpt('proxy_request_timeout', default=0, help=_('Request timeout in seconds Ironic conductor uses ' 'while sending a request to the proxy')), cfg.StrOpt('console_port_range', default='10000:20000', help=_('Port range for the Ironic node consoles')) ] CONF.register_opts(ipmiproxy_opts, 'ipmiproxy') PROXY_REQUIRED_VERSION = '1' def _ipmiproxy_request(method, path, data=None, headers=None, **kwargs): """Send a request to the IPMI proxy :param method: request method such as GET, POST, DELETE... :param path: url path such as /v1/nodes/<UUID>/console/serial :param data: data object to send :param headers: request headers :param kwargs: args will be passed to requests :return: response object """ protocol = 'https' if CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_ca_file else 'http' url = ('%(scheme)s://%(host)s:%(port)s%(path)s' % {'scheme': protocol, 'host': CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_address, 'port': CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_admin_port, 'path': path}) req_headers = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } if headers: req_headers.update(headers) req_auth = None if CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_auth_key: req_auth = HTTPBasicAuth('ironic', CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_auth_key) req_data = None if data: req_data = json.dumps(data, encoding='utf-8') req_timeout = None if CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_request_timeout > 0: req_timeout = CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_request_timeout # TODO(tiendc): For python ver < 2.7.9, 3.2, requests seems to fail to # verify the secure connection with CA file due to the SNI support. # It may return the error "Hostname does not match". # Ref: https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/749 return requests.api.request(method, url, headers=req_headers, data=req_data, timeout=req_timeout, auth=req_auth, verify=CONF.ipmiproxy.proxy_ca_file, **kwargs) def _parse_response_data(response): """Parse the response data as json string""" encoding = response.encoding if not encoding: encoding = 'utf-8' return json.loads(response.text, encoding=encoding) def get_serial_console_bridge_info(node): """Retrieve the IPMI console bridge info for the node The sample returned data: { 'console': { 'serial': { 'proxy': <URL> } } } """ url = ('/v%(ver)s/nodes/%(node)s/console/serial' % {'ver': PROXY_REQUIRED_VERSION, 'node': node.uuid}) try: response = _ipmiproxy_request('GET', url) if response.status_code == requests.codes.ok: return _parse_response_data(response) else: raise Exception(six.text_type(response.reason)) except Exception as ex: raise exception.IPMIProxyRequestException(error=six.text_type(ex)) def create_serial_console_bridge( node, ipmi_info, console_info=None, proxy_info=None): """Request the proxy to create an IPMI console bridge for the node""" url = ('/v%(ver)s/nodes/%(node)s/console/serial' % {'ver': PROXY_REQUIRED_VERSION, 'node': node.uuid}) data = { 'ipmi-info': ipmi_info, 'console-info': console_info if console_info else {}, 'proxy-info': proxy_info if proxy_info else {}, } try: response = _ipmiproxy_request('POST', url, data=data) if response.status_code == requests.codes.ok: return _parse_response_data(response) else: raise Exception(six.text_type(response.reason)) except Exception as ex: raise exception.IPMIProxyRequestException(error=six.text_type(ex)) def delete_serial_console_bridge(node): """Request the proxy to delete the IPMI console bridge for the node""" url = ('/v%(ver)s/nodes/%(node)s/console/serial' % {'ver': PROXY_REQUIRED_VERSION, 'node': node.uuid}) try: response = _ipmiproxy_request('DELETE', url) if response.status_code == requests.codes.ok: # Deleting console bridge may return nothing pass else: raise Exception(six.text_type(response.reason)) except Exception as ex: raise exception.IPMIProxyRequestException(error=six.text_type(ex))

added_lines: import sixfrom ironic.common.i18n import _LIfrom ironic.drivers.modules import ipmiproxy_utilsclass NativeIPMIProxyConsole(base.ConsoleInterface): """A ConsoleInterface that uses pyghmi and ipmiproxy.""" def get_properties(self): d = COMMON_PROPERTIES.copy() d.update(CONSOLE_PROPERTIES) return d def validate(self, task): """Validate the Node console info. :param task: a TaskManager instance containing the node to act on. :raises MissingParameterValue: when required IPMI credentials or the IPMI terminal port are missing. :raises InvalidParameterValue: when the IPMI terminal port is not an integer. """ driver_info = _parse_driver_info(task.node) if not driver_info['port']: raise exception.MissingParameterValue(_( "Missing 'ipmi_terminal_port' parameter in node's" " driver_info.")) def start_console(self, task): """Start a remote console for the node. :param task: a task from TaskManager :raises MissingParameterValue: when required ipmi credentials are missing. :raises InvalidParameterValue: when the IPMI terminal port is not an integer. :raises ConsoleError: if unable to start the console """ driver_info = _parse_driver_info(task.node) console_info = { 'type': 'ipminative' } ipmi_info = { 'address': driver_info['address'], 'username': driver_info['username'], 'password': driver_info['password'], } proxy_info = { 'port': driver_info['port'] } try: ipmiproxy_utils.create_serial_console_bridge( node_uuid=task.node.uuid, ipmi_info=ipmi_info, console_info=console_info, proxy_info=proxy_info) LOG.info(_LI('Started IPMI console bridge for node %s'), task.node.uuid) except Exception as ex: msg = (_('Failed to create IPMI console bridge ' 'for node %(node)s. Reason: %(reason)s') % {'node': task.node.uuid, 'reason': six.text_type(ex)}) LOG.warning(msg) raise exception.ConsoleError(message=msg) def stop_console(self, task): """Stop the remote console session for the node. :param task: a task from TaskManager :raises ConsoleError: if unable to stop the console """ try: ipmiproxy_utils.delete_serial_console_bridge( node_uuid=task.node.uuid) LOG.info(_LI('Stopped IPMI console bridge for node %s'), task.node.uuid) except exception.IPMIConsoleBridgeNotFound: # We ignore this case LOG.warning(_LW('IPMI console bridge not found for node %s'), task.node.uuid) except Exception as ex: msg = (_('Failed to delete IPMI console bridge for ' 'node %(node)s. Reason: %(reason)s') % {'node': task.node.uuid, 'reason': six.text_type(ex)}) LOG.warning(msg) raise exception.ConsoleError(message=msg) def get_console(self, task): """Get the type and connection information about the console. :param task: a task from TaskManager :raises ConsoleError: if unable to get the console """ try: bridge_info = ipmiproxy_utils.get_serial_console_bridge_info( node_uuid=task.node.uuid) url = bridge_info['console']['serial']['url'] return {'type': 'ipmiproxy', 'url': url} except Exception as ex: msg = (_('Failed to retrieve IPMI console bridge info ' 'for node %(node)s. Reason: %(reason)s') % {'node': task.node.uuid, 'reason': six.text_type(ex)}) LOG.warning(msg) raise exception.ConsoleError(message=msg)

commit_message:
Add API tests for node action

Add API tests for triggering node action

blueprint tempest-plugin-interface

Change-Id: Iaafdd3190dba9cd5173d676b2010ad3c6f9215a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/67/313967/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.lib import decorators from senlin.tests.tempest.api import base from senlin.tests.tempest.common import constants class TestNodeDelete(base.BaseSenlinTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(TestNodeDelete, cls).resource_setup() # Create profile cls.profile = cls.create_profile(constants.spec_nova_server) # Create test node cls.node = cls.create_test_node(cls.profile['id']) @classmethod def resource_cleanup(cls): # Delete node cls.delete_test_node(cls.node['id']) # Delete profile cls.delete_profile(cls.profile['id']) super(TestNodeDelete, cls).resource_cleanup() @decorators.idempotent_id('ae124bfe-9fcf-4e87-91b7-319102efbdcc') def test_node_action_trigger(self): params = { 'check': { } } # Trigger cluster action res = self.client.trigger_action('nodes', self.node['id'], params=params) # Verfiy resp code, body and location in headers self.assertEqual(202, res['status']) self.assertIn('actions', res['location']) action_id = res['location'].split('/actions/')[1] self.wait_for_status('actions', action_id, 'SUCCEEDED')

commit_message:
Add find interface to glance v2 client

v1 find/findall interfaces(ex. images.find) are not available
with v2 client. This patch introduces class BaseController.
Controllers can now extend from it to support them.

Change-Id: If672ff9b6037321af478c6e786b9f949ee4defc2
Closes-Bug: #1535298

subject: Adding tempest-horizon repo and job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-03 22:41:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/ff1d0c23987cb1fa88c18a7e0dc6a123983531a3', 'message': 'Adding tempest-horizon repo and job

In an effort to make the overall gate more robust and still
allow Horizon to update their xstatic packages, this patch
adds a repo containing the current horizon tempest scenario
tests in tempest plugin form. The patch also adds a non-voting
check job to allow testing of the plugin.

Without this change, it is possible to break the gate by
updating xstatic packages before Horizon can support the new
version. This sad truth is an offshoot of the difficultly of
supporting the many incompatibilities between versions of
javascript libraries.

Once the new job is verified and added to the horizon gate, the
current horizon scenario tests in openstack/tempest would be
removed.

Change-Id: I1608407a4f8246728c30870fd5e1886c632e7734
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-04 15:36:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/0846152a41a09d4b971d1f4e1f117504971c18e5', 'message': 'Adding tempest-horizon repo and job

In an effort to make the overall gate more robust and still
allow Horizon to update their xstatic packages, this patch
adds a repo containing the current horizon tempest scenario
tests in tempest plugin form. The patch also adds a non-voting
check job to allow testing of the plugin.

Without this change, it is possible to break the gate by
updating xstatic packages before Horizon can support the new
version. This sad truth is an offshoot of the difficultly of
supporting the many incompatibilities between versions of
javascript libraries.

Once the new job is verified and added to the horizon gate, the
current horizon scenario tests in openstack/tempest would be

commit_message:
Adding tempest-horizon repo and job

In an effort to make the overall gate more robust and still
allow Horizon to update their xstatic packages, this patch
adds a repo containing the current horizon tempest scenario
tests in tempest plugin form. The patch also adds a non-voting
check job to allow testing of the plugin.

Without this change, it is possible to break the gate by
updating xstatic packages before Horizon can support the new
version. This sad truth is an offshoot of the difficultly of
supporting the many incompatibilities between versions of
javascript libraries.

Once the new job is verified and added to the horizon gate, the
current horizon scenario tests in openstack/tempest would be
removed.

Needed-By: Ib01a69ffb978708ad7b515d3aaa4b58bc894a167
Change-Id: I1608407a4f8246728c30870fd5e1886c632e7734

commit_message:
Retire operations-guide and ha-guide (2/2)

The Docs team has decided to merge the contents of these guides to
openstack-manuals and retire the repositories.

This is the second step: Make repositories read-only. The content
of the repositories has been cleaned up.

commit_message:
Fix test failure against latest oslo.* from master

Looks like there's a lot of places in Neutron tests we are
using res.json['NeutronError']['message'] to look at the
exact message and we missed a spot

Closes-Bug: #1561151

commit_message:
Nova serial console support

This spec proposes adding support for Nova serial console into
Ironic. The solution is to add an IPMIProxy and using socat program.

Some reference implementation:
[IPMI proxy]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/303894
[Console drivers]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/304933
[Nova side]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/304942

Change-Id: Ic74b0ac0dc8fd8a51e692f0de88ef087fde943da
Related-Bug: #1553083

commit_message:
Add gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh to periodic

THe gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh is quite close to be running
fine, but we don't have enough data from kibana to tell when the
job is stable enough.

Adding this to periodic will allow collecting data, so we can take
an informed decision about making ssh checks voting.

Change-Id: I34ae82f8199cc38bcdb61f94a316d87ccd3d8ae8

commit_message:
Add Cheesecake APIs to policy.json file

These replication v2.1 APIs are not enforced by the
cinder policy.json file. This patch adds policy and
the code to support applying this policy action.

  "volume:failover_host": "rule:admin_api",
  "volume:freeze_host": "rule:admin_api",
  "volume:thaw_host": "rule:admin_api",

Also these methods create a completely new context
instead of doing context.elevated(). It's better
to preserve the information that already there.

Change-Id: Ib577e902cda634ae2bd813edd9e39e022f23fde1
Closes-Bug: #1578722

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 12:10:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/e8ddea037a8ca522512c0b8131886eb2e9c4ac0f', 'message': 'Modify the expected status in handle_check

Command action-check is aimed to check if the stack resources
are in expected states.
For nova server resource, The expected check status should be
"SUSPENDED" when user have executed action-suspend on stack.
So, the expected state should be the value which stored in heat db.

Change-Id: I630e9331e0a94911e6fe40846ad9d3e16486bd8b
Closes-Bug: #1569218
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-21 15:50:43.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/1b13a1a7367e4e4c6aa7be627d13981c7c8c9eb3', 'message': 'Modify the expected status in handle_check

Command action-check is aimed to check if the stack resources are
in expected states. For Heat, it can make a server become ACTIVE
or SUSPENDED. So, the expected check status of nova server resource
should be ['SUSPENDED','ACTIVE'].

Another reason for this change is, if the expected status of server
is only "ACTIVE", In this situation(stack has a server resource):
Stack Create ->Stack Suspend ->Stack Check ->Stack Suspend/Stack Resume
it will fail due to check failed, then the server stuck into "suspended"
status.

Change-Id: I630e9331e0a94911e6fe40846ad9d3e16486bd8b
Closes-Bug: #1569218
'}]
commit_message:
Modify the expected status in handle_check

Command action-check is aimed to check if the stack resources are
in expected states. For Heat, it can make a server become ACTIVE
or SUSPENDED. So, the expected check status of nova server resource
should be ['SUSPENDED','ACTIVE'].

Another reason for this change is, if the expected status of server
is only "ACTIVE", In this situation(stack has a server resource):
Stack Create ->Stack Suspend ->Stack Check ->Stack Suspend/Stack Resume
it will fail due to check failed, then the server stuck into "suspended"
status.

Change-Id: I630e9331e0a94911e6fe40846ad9d3e16486bd8b
Closes-Bug: #1569218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/52/304552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add some test cases for test volume set command v2

Set volume commands are defined in
openstackclient/v2/volume.py. But no relevant unit tests exist.
This patch add some unit test cases for testing these commands.

Patially-Implements: blueprint improve-volume-unittest-framework
Change-Id: I8355c8dcbe8d3f474f8e43d452c7e8cf572c0b68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/47/282847/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

loaded=True ) self.volumes_mock.set_metadata.return_value = None self.volumes_mock.update.return_value = None # Get the command object to mock self.cmd = volume.SetVolume(self.app, None) def verifylist = [ ("volume", volume_fakes.volume_id), ("name", "new_volume"), ("property", new_property) ] kwargs = { "display_name": "new_volume", "display_description": "new_vol" } parsed_args = commit_message:
Config options: centralize iser libvirt options (11)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then move another options in libvirt section.
This is the 11th patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: I879d668f95f507ca193fad2d21a9465c3b3a2062
Co-Authored-by: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

commit_message:
Add hint info in resume error message

For the situation:
Stack Create -> Stack Suspend -> Stack Check -> Stack Resume
stack resume will fail for State (u'CHECK', u'COMPLETE') invalid for resume.

We can do like this under this situation :
Stack Create -> Stack Suspend -> Stack Check -> Stack Resume
-> Stack Suspend -> Stack Resume

So, This change added the hint info to tell user that
"you must execute action-suspend first and then execute action-resume."

Change-Id: I28a19c366aed3d810b201cb758a7abb544177188
Closes-Bug: #1506042
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/02/304502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exc = exception.Error(_('State %s invalid for resume, you must ' 'execute action-suspend first and then' ' execute action-resume.')
deleted_lines: exc = exception.Error(_('State %s invalid for resume')

commit_message:
Don't use two different names for the same flag

The nested_abandon_in_progress flag in the StackResource class is used in
exactly the same way and does exactly the same thing as the
abandon_in_progress flag does in every other Resource class, except that it
does the Wrong Thing when adopting a stack fails.

Change-Id: I47e412169f58734b8684a645470180d95e13def6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/41/311641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.nested_abandon_in_progress = False if self.nested_abandon_in_progress: self.nested_abandon_in_progress = True

Remove KUBE_API_PUBLIC_ADDRESS

KUBE_API_PUBLIC_ADDRESS will not be accessed in the bay. It is
accessed by users outside.

commit_message:
Ignore domain related config when using with keystone v2

Currently, "/usr/bin/openstack --insecure token issue"
fails when OS_AUTH_URL and OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION
indicate keystone v2 if OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME or
OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME are set. This patchset ignore domain
related configs if using with keystone v2.

Change-Id: If7eea2ed1a4877c60d055ed0114a5e5f31e282a0
Closes-bug: #1447704
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/14/301014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(hieulq): If USER_DOMAIN_NAME or PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME is present # and API_VERSION is 2.0, then ignore all domain related configs. if (self._api_version.get('identity') == '2.0' and self.auth_plugin_name.endswith('password') and ('project_domain_name' in self._auth_params or 'user_domain_name' in self._auth_params)): LOG.warning("Ignoring domain related config " "because API version is 2.0") self._auth_params.pop('project_domain_name') self._auth_params.pop('user_domain_name')

commit_message:
Disable nova quota for dsvm functional test

Parallel execution of tacker functional test ends up
creating lots of VMs and eventually fails hitting the
default max instance of 10. This fix disables quota for
tacker functional test suite. However gate VMs still has
upper constraint on resources like 8GB max limit. To avoid
tripping the actual gate VM resource limit reduce concurrency
to a lower number (2).

Change-Id: I3fe8c012b85554fa21b5b4b64378d68e3d979cc2
Closes-Bug: #1572420

commit_message:
Fix translation test

We do not store pot files anymore in git. Fix run_tests.sh that expects
that these are in git. To restore normal content, just remove the
generated files.

Change-Id: Ief0861e01ff758120001f4c8dfdbf9afadf09f5b

commit_message:
Cleanup volume_attachment in case of reset-state attach_status

We have the ability to use reset-state to get the volume back
to a usable state, but current reset-state only changes
status, attach_status and migration_status for volume 'table'
of target volume.
This means target volume entry in the 'volume_attachment' table
keeps remaining even after resetting attach_status.
When the volume will be attached again, multiple instances
will be shown in "Attached to" of "cinder list" unexpectedly.

This patch adds a cleanup for volume_attachment of target
volume when attach_status equals 'detached'.

Change-Id: Ibd403ececffe5d10eff68304ba82f55ed7d43975
Closes-Bug: #1568034
(cherry picked from commit ea19c4a5431c445e7199a64062210188dd2b0137)
Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/52/307452/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # start service to handle rpc messages for attach requests self.svc = self.start_service('volume', host='test') def tearDown(self): self.svc.stop() super(AdminActionsTest, self).tearDown() # current status is available volume = self._create_volume(self.ctx, {'provider_location': '', 'size': 1}) self.volume_api.reserve_volume(self.ctx, volume) mountpoint = '/dev/vdb' attachment = self.volume_api.attach(self.ctx, volume, fake.instance_id, None, mountpoint, 'rw') # volume is attached volume = db.volume_get(self.ctx.elevated(), volume['id']) attachment = db.volume_attachment_get(self.ctx, attachment['id']) self.assertEqual('in-use', volume['status']) self.assertEqual('attached', volume['attach_status']) self.assertEqual(stubs.fake.instance_id, attachment['instance_uuid']) self.assertEqual(mountpoint, attachment['mountpoint']) self.assertEqual('attached', attachment['attach_status']) admin_metadata = volume['volume_admin_metadata'] self.assertEqual(2, len(admin_metadata)) self.assertEqual('readonly', admin_metadata[0]['key']) self.assertEqual('False', admin_metadata[0]['value']) self.assertEqual('attached_mode', admin_metadata[1]['key']) self.assertEqual('rw', admin_metadata[1]['value']) # Reset attach_status # request is accepted # volume is detached admin_metadata = volume['volume_admin_metadata'] self.assertEqual(1, len(admin_metadata)) self.assertEqual('readonly', admin_metadata[0]['key']) self.assertEqual('False', admin_metadata[0]['value']) self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeAttachmentNotFound, db.volume_attachment_get, self.ctx, attachment['id'])

Release note for scheduler rework

added_lines: --- features: - Engine scheduler was redesigned to work in "tickless" way: each time scheduler receives a start_action notification, it will try to acquire and schedule all actions in READY status. This change removes lots of unnecessary rpc requests from engine to dispatcher and significantly increase the efficiency of scheduler.

commit_message:
Do not use network_api_class option

network_api_class is deprecated in Neutron and will be removed.
Set use_neutron to true as nova::network::neutron is a Neutron-specific class,
network_api_class parameter becomes useless and doesn't take any effect

Closes-Bug: #1567157
Change-Id: Ifc1b569c21e3bff6d160c8c5ac28895de28e6370
(cherry picked from commit 3201927ce35c1c64b502ab27f8d9083d6c8a65a3)

commit_message:
Add snapshot_metadata operations to policy.json

These snapshot_metadata APIs are not enforced by
the cinder policy.json file. This patch adds
policy and the code to support applying this
policy action.

 "volume:get_snapshot_metadata": "rule:admin_or_owner",
 "volume:delete_snapshot_metadata": "rule:admin_or_owner",
 "volume:update_snapshot_metadata": "rule:admin_or_owner",

Change-Id: I8c0ef554e71c008cacd610eee9767173dfcca082
Closes-bug: #1578829

class OvsDBParser(object): def _ovsdb_list_intefaces(self, specify_interface=None): full_args = ["ovs-vsctl", "list", 'interface'] if specify_interface: full_args.append(specify_interface) interfaces_info = utils.execute(full_args, run_as_root=True, process_input=None) return interfaces_info def _trim_double_quotation(self, value): if len(value) != 0 and value[0] == '"': return value[1:-1] return value def _parse_one_item(self, str_item): value = None start_index = str_item.find(': ') if start_index != -1: value = str_item[start_index+2:] if value[0] == '[': items_str = value[1:-1] value = [] if len(items_str) != 0: items = items_str.split(', ') for loop in items: value.append(self._trim_double_quotation(loop)) elif value[0] == '{': items_str = value[1:-1] value = {} if len(items_str) != 0: items = items_str.split(', ') for loop in items: key_value = loop.split('=') value[key_value[0]] = \ self._trim_double_quotation(key_value[1]) else: value = self._trim_double_quotation(value) return value def _parse_ovsdb_interfaces(self, interfaces): interfaces_list = interfaces.split("

") interfaces_as_dicts = [] for inteface in interfaces_list: if len(inteface) == 0: continue fs = inteface.split("
") res = {} for item in fs: if item.startswith('external_ids'): res['external_ids'] = self._parse_one_item(item) elif item.startswith('ofport '): res['ofport'] = self._parse_one_item(item) elif item.startswith('name'): res['name'] = self._parse_one_item(item) interfaces_as_dicts.append(res) return interfaces_as_dicts def list_interfaces(self, specify_interface=None): interfaces = self._ovsdb_list_intefaces(specify_interface) return self._parse_ovsdb_interfaces(interfaces)

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.lib import decorators from senlin.tests.tempest.api import base from senlin.tests.tempest.common import constants class TestPolicyDelete(base.BaseSenlinTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(TestPolicyDelete, cls).resource_setup() # Create policy cls.policy = cls.create_policy(constants.spec_scaling_policy) @decorators.idempotent_id('b707e4e3-3d42-4a9f-9a09-3e330959b498') def test_delete_policy(self): # Verify resp of policy delete API res = self.client.delete_obj('policies', self.policy['id']) self.assertEqual(204, res['status']) self.assertIsNone(res['body'])

commit_message:
SSH: add SocatConsole class

SocatConsole is a new console driver class using virsh and socat. It
has the same APIs of ShellinaboxConsole class and provides
TCP4/TCP6/SSL connection service to connect virtual console of nodes.

And get_console_driver() selects one of ShellinaboxConsole() and
SocatConsole(), depends on CONF.console.terminal.

- CONF.console.terminal contains "shellinaboxd":
   get_console_driver() returns ShellinaboxConsole()
- CONF.console.terminal contains "socat":
   get_console_driver() returns SocatConsole()
- Other cases (default):
   get_console_driver() returns ShellinaboxConsole()

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: I5467fba6552d0e63d41abe297f82655243517845
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/75/293875/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.console = ssh.get_console_driver()
deleted_lines: self.console = ssh.ShellinaboxConsole()

subject: console utils: add methods for serial console with socat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-17 08:25:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/fbce5abc4466ea3969f869827941e4f3a1f5e40b', 'message': 'console utils: add methods for serial console with socat

This commit adds 3 methods to use socat below:

- get_socat_console_url(port)
    returns an URL for clients
- start_socat_console(node_uuid, port, console_cmd)
    runs socat for a specified command
- stop_socat_console(node_uuid)
    stops a running socat process

Each has the same API as one for shellinabox.
And 2 parameters are added:

- terminal_cert_file (str)
  specifies the .pem file containing its ceritificate and private key.
- terminal_ca_file (str)
  the .crt file containing the certificate of the peer.

Implements bp:nova-compatible-serial-console

Change-Id: Icec2ec20590d5ead561ce9559c9bb7ab96b3c0ce
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 08:45:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/6821743c757df4288283fb6455905c4bd62479f4', 'message': 'console utils: add methods for serial console with socat

commit_message:
console utils: add methods for serial console with socat

This commit adds 3 methods to use socat below:

- get_socat_console_url(port)
    returns an URL for clients
- start_socat_console(node_uuid, port, console_cmd)
    runs socat for a specified command
- stop_socat_console(node_uuid)
    stops a running socat process

Each has the same API as one for shellinabox.
And 2 parameters are added:

- terminal_cert_file (str)
  specifies the .pem file containing its ceritificate and private key.
- terminal_ca_file (str)
  the .crt file containing the certificate of the peer.

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: Icec2ec20590d5ead561ce9559c9bb7ab96b3c0ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/71/293871/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ironic: add get_serial_console()

Finally, ironic got a capability to export remote serial console
via TCP/SSL connection. This patch adds get_serial_console() to use
it with nova-serialproxy.

NOTE: nova-serialproxy currently supports only TCP sockets.

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Depends-On: 55aa693f1f242b5d0edfb44bc1d8d5f5f6b5ac98
Change-Id: Ie24baedb80d43d0587f3f4f332cb0d97cf9f55ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/293878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.console import type as ctype @mock.patch.object(ironic_driver.IronicDriver, '_validate_instance_and_node') @mock.patch.object(FAKE_CLIENT, 'node') def test_get_serial_console(self, mock_node, mock_validate): node = ironic_utils.get_test_node() instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj(self.ctx, node=node.uuid) mock_validate.return_value = node mock_node.get_console.return_value = { 'console_enabled': True, 'console_info': { 'type': 'socat', 'url': 'tcp://127.0.0.1:10000' } } result = self.driver.get_serial_console(self.ctx, instance) self.assertIsInstance(result, ctype.ConsoleSerial) mock_validate.assert_called_once_with(instance) self.assertEqual(2, mock_node.get_console.call_count) @mock.patch.object(ironic_driver.IronicDriver, '_validate_instance_and_node') @mock.patch.object(FAKE_CLIENT, 'node') def test_get_serial_console_disabled(self, mock_node, mock_validate): node = ironic_utils.get_test_node() instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj(self.ctx, node=node.uuid) mock_validate.return_value = node mock_node.get_console.return_value = { 'console_enabled': False, 'console_info': { 'type': 'socat', 'url': 'tcp://127.0.0.1:10000' } } result = self.driver.get_serial_console(self.ctx, instance) self.assertIsInstance(result, ctype.ConsoleSerial) mock_validate.assert_called_once_with(instance) self.assertEqual(2, mock_node.get_console.call_count) mock_node.set_console_mode.assert_called_once_with(node.uuid, True) @mock.patch.object(ironic_driver.IronicDriver, '_validate_instance_and_node') @mock.patch.object(FAKE_CLIENT, 'node') def test_get_serial_console_shellinabox(self, mock_node, mock_validate): node = ironic_utils.get_test_node() instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj(self.ctx, node=node.uuid) mock_validate.return_value = node mock_node.get_console.return_value = { 'console_enabled': True, 'console_info': { 'type': 'shellinabox', 'url': 'http://127.0.0.1:10000' } } self.assertRaises(exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable, self.driver.get_serial_console, self.ctx, instance) @mock.patch.object(ironic_driver.IronicDriver, '_validate_instance_and_node') @mock.patch.object(FAKE_CLIENT, 'node') def test_get_serial_console_ssl(self, mock_node, mock_validate): node = ironic_utils.get_test_node() instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj(self.ctx, node=node.uuid) mock_validate.return_value = node mock_node.get_console.return_value = { 'console_enabled': True, 'console_info': { 'type': 'socat', 'url': 'ssl://127.0.0.1:10000' } } self.assertRaises(exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable, self.driver.get_serial_console, self.ctx, instance)

commit_message:
Add nova-compatible-serial-console.rst to not-implemented

This adds nova-compatible-serial-console spec to the list of approved
and not-implemented.

Partial-Bug: #1553083
Change-Id: I997c8115cac6140f6d9cab1a126f6361c6490848
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/27/293827/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Nova-compatible Serial Console ============================== FYI: [RFE] Nova serial console support for Ironic https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1553083 This implements console drivers using "socat" which provides nova- compatible serial console capability. Problem description =================== Currently there is shellinaboxd-based web console drivers, stand-alone web console and not compatible with nova-serialproxy. Proposed change =============== Adds new console drivers using socat. Currently, we're planing to implement below: * ironic.drivers.modules.ipmitool.IPMISocatConsole * ironic.drivers.modules.ipminative.NativeIPMISocatConsole * ironic.drivers.modules.ssh.SocatConsole Also implements get_console_driver() method for each modules above. It returns *ShellinaboxConsole object if CONF.cosnole.terminal contains "shellinaboxd", *SocatConsole object if it contains "socat". Otherwise, it returns *ShellinaboxConsole object as the default. To do so, we need some methods like *_shellinabox_console*() in ironic.drivers.modules.console_utils: - ``start_socat_console(node_uuid, port, console_cmd)`` starts a command like ipmitool via socat. - ``stop_console(self, task)`` - stops a socat process. - ``get_console(self, task)`` - returns a dictionaly contains the serial console information. Alternatives ------------ Dao Cong Tien (tiendc) has an idea at the RFE above. It looks complex and a new service proxy required. See the commits for details. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/267371/ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/267384/ Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- The response body of "GET /v1/nodes/<UUID>/states/console" contains a JSON object like below:: { "console_enabled": true, "console_info": { "url": <url>, "type": <type> } } Using shellinaboxd, <url> is like "http://<host>:<port>" and <type> is "shellinabox". For the new serial console, <url> should be like "tcp://<host>:<port>" and <type> also be "socat". No change required for the request. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ get_serial_console() will be in ironic driver of Nova. It returns a dictionary, as same as nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.get_serial_console(). No other impact for nova and nova-serialproxy works well with the new one. Security impact --------------- The connection between nova-serialproxy and socat is TCP based, like KVM. Socat supports OpenSSL connections, so we can improve the security in the future. Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The following configuration parameter are added into [console] section in ironic.conf:: * ``terminal_cert_file`` - the terminal SSL cert(PEM) file for socat serial console access (string value). * ``terminal_ca_file`` - The CA file of cert_file, for socat serial console access (string value) If you want use the new serial console, set ``socat`` as a value of ``terminal`` parameter like below:: * ``terminal`` = socat The variable is originally for full path of the binary. So, you can specify socat like below:: * ``terminal`` = /usr/bin/socat Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Akira Yoshiyama <akirayoshiyama@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- Implement ``*SocatConsole`` class inherited from ``base.ManagementInterface``. Implement ``validate`` , ``start_console``, ``stop_console``, ``get_console``. Implement ``start_socat_console``, ``stop_socat_console`` and ``get_socat_console_url``. Dependencies ============ socat program. http://www.dest-unreach.org/socat/ Testing ======= Unit Testing will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== Add configuration description to the install guide. References ========== None

Show details about the given image.``volume-create`` **DEPRECATED**: Add a new volume. ``volume-delete`` **DEPRECATED**: Remove volume(s). ``volume-list`` **DEPRECATED**: List all the volumes. ``volume-show`` **DEPRECATED**: Show details about a volume. ``volume-snapshot-create`` **DEPRECATED**: Add a new snapshot. ``volume-snapshot-delete`` **DEPRECATED**: Remove a snapshot. ``volume-snapshot-list`` **DEPRECATED**: List all the snapshots. ``volume-snapshot-show`` **DEPRECATED**: Show details about a snapshot. ``volume-type-create`` **DEPRECATED**: Create a new volume type. ``volume-type-delete`` **DEPRECATED**: Delete a specific volume type. ``volume-type-list`` **DEPRECATED**: Print a list of available 'volume types'. ``baremetal-interface-add`` Add a network interface to a baremetal node. ``baremetal-interface-remove`` Remove a network interface from a baremetal node. ``baremetal-node-create`` Create a baremetal node. ``baremetal-node-delete`` Remove a baremetal node and any associated interfaces. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~.. _nova_baremetal-interface-add: nova baremetal-interface-add ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console usage: nova baremetal-interface-add [--datapath_id <datapath_id>] [--port_no <port_no>] <node> <address> Add a network interface to a baremetal node. **Positional arguments:** ``<node>`` ID of node ``<address>`` MAC address of interface **Optional arguments:** ``--datapath_id <datapath_id>`` OpenFlow Datapath ID of interface ``--port_no <port_no>`` OpenFlow port number of interface ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~.. _nova_baremetal-interface-remove: nova baremetal-interface-remove ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console usage: nova baremetal-interface-remove <node> <address> Remove a network interface from a baremetal node. **Positional arguments:** ``<node>`` ID of node ``<address>`` MAC address of interface .. _nova_baremetal-node-create: nova baremetal-node-create ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console usage: nova baremetal-node-create [--pm_address <pm_address>] [--pm_user <pm_user>] [--pm_password <pm_password>] [--terminal_port <terminal_port>] <service_host> <cpus> <memory_mb> <local_gb> <prov_mac_address> Create a baremetal node. **Positional arguments:** ``<service_host>`` Name of nova compute host which will control this baremetal node ``<cpus>`` Number of CPUs in the node ``<memory_mb>`` Megabytes of RAM in the node ``<local_gb>`` Gigabytes of local storage in the node ``<prov_mac_address>`` MAC address to provision the node **Optional arguments:** ``--pm_address <pm_address>`` Power management IP for the node ``--pm_user <pm_user>`` Username for the node's power management ``--pm_password <pm_password>`` Password for the node's power management ``--terminal_port <terminal_port>`` ShellInABox port? .. _nova_baremetal-node-delete: nova baremetal-node-delete ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console usage: nova baremetal-node-delete <node> Remove a baremetal node and any associated interfaces. **Positional arguments:** ``<node>`` ID of the node to delete. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Name or ID of image (see 'nova image-list'). pci: Allow to assign pci devices in pci device list

This patch allow the pci device list constructor to
be init with list of pci devices

commit_message:
Use TinyIPA and iPXE for most Ironic jobs

Unless there's a good reason to do otherwise, we want to use TinyIPA
(smaller ram footprint, faster boot times) and iPXE (uses http for all
transfers, reducing random failures due to network issues) for all
Ironic jobs.

With tinyipa being the default ramdisk for the Ironic tempest jobs, we
now gate IPA on both tinyipa and coreos ramdisks, to prevent breakage to
a single ramdisk being merged into IPA.

This follows the pattern expected of IPA->Ironic job interaction: IPA
gates on all possible supported ramdisks, then Ironic uses the one best
suited to CI to test all jobs, with IPA gate jobs ensuring that no
changes go in that break a single ramdisk.

Change-Id: I834f2b9d63260a4ae67a0b5d9a203cb7824e54ba

commit_message:
Return BadRequest for 4 byte unicode characters

Various create and update apis are returning 500 error
when you pass 4 byte unicode characters in the request.

This patch fixes the issue to return HTTP 400 Bad Request.

1. md-namespace-create
2. md-namespace-update
3. md-property-create
4. md-property-update
5. md-object-create
6. md-object-update
7. md-tag-create
8. md-tag-update

APIImpact: For all of the above APIs, it will return 400 error instead
of 500 if user passes 4 byte unicode characters in the request.

Closes-Bug: #1570789
Change-Id:  I8233cf95310aa2671ebc62995c58208024fc38a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/24/306424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Skip test_network_basic_ops smoke test

This seems to be failing continuously and needs
to be fixed. This is blocking heat gate as the devstack-gate
runs this as part of the tempest smoke tests after an upgrade.

commit_message:
Force bashate to use python2.7

tox defaults to whatever version of python tox itself was run under.

bashate fails when run under python3, so force the bashate testenv to
use python2.7, regardless of the tox default.

For posterity, the py3 failure is:
[...]
File ".../devstack/.tox/bashate/lib/python3.5/site-packages/bashate/bashate.py", line 279, in check_files
    check_syntax(fname, report)
File ".../devstack/.tox/bashate/lib/python3.5/site-packages/bashate/bashate.py", line 179, in check_syntax
    for line in outputs[1].split('\n'):
TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'

Change-Id: Ic91b5ce8cb85e376573f9bf3659d2a86cc437179
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/06/309406/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python2.7

commit_message:
DRBD: extend volume if larger than snapshot

Extend volume if during create_volume_from_snapshot() the new volume
is larger than the snapshot it was created from. Moved resize checks
and calls from create_cloned_volume() to create_volume_from_snapshot()
to reuse code.

Extended and added new test cases to cover the change.

Closes-Bug: #1560636

Change-Id: I16c93ce272320a72964ea2f8727b3f0fb24149f7
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

commit_message:
Add possibility to delete blob from artifact

Add possibility to delete blob from artifact blob property or
delete blob from artifact blob list property.
The patch defines appropriate route and deletion logic for these
blobs.

ApiImpact
FastTrack
Change-Id: If16f2bfe80082d90ebc970306ba2eaa8b3e04bb7
Closes-bug: #1491815

commit_message:
Add possibility to create public artifacts

The patch adds possibility to specify visibility field
when creating an artifact.
It was not possible before because the value of visibility field
was hard-coded.

FastTrack
Closes-bug: #1489942

Change-Id: Ic66a9987bb35669599a1d4bc470abde79647383d

commit_message:
Fix index check when replacing blob items in artifacts

Glance should validate which items in blob list we can replace:
the index of the item should less than blob_list size and
index value should be positive.
The patch adds this check to artifact implementation.
In addition some small refactoring of _upload_list_property
method was mage to improve code clarity.

Change-Id: I52877af9ff50be90c684bee43effae567374008b
Closes-bug: #1493833

commit_message:
Fix replacing of item in blob list

When specifying a new value for existing item in blob list glance
didn't check if this value already exists and we need to clear it.
The patch fixes this and alows Glance to clean up blob item in
list before update.

FastTrack
Change-Id: I947a67c0ff32dae07ff5d921dee22da16116c4ce
Closes-bug: #1491823

commit_message:
Support replacing of blobs in artifacts

The patch adds support of updating existing blobs in Glance.
Glance executes blob delete if the current blob does exist
and uploads a new blob after that.
If the new blob value is None then Glance just deletes blob
from Glance.
The patch also fixes incorrect attribute usage in exceptions
that will be raising by Glance when deleting a blob from store.

FastTrack
Closes-bug: #1493826
Change-Id: Iff44304dac92b4663f9800300dca7ab631f87b9f

commit_message:
Sheepdog: Fix default sheepdog_store_address of glance-api.conf

The string of sheepdog_store_address is used by dog command
to specify the IP address of the sheep server.

In addition, dog command can't handle hostname and can handle
the strings of IP address only.

Previously the entry was 'localhost' and dog command couldn't handle it.
To fix this the glance_store has been updated to change the default to '127.0.0.1'.

So, this patch changes the documentation from 'localhost' to '127.0.0.1' to
reflect the glance_store change.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I601233fb75e2737a02e7af25a59062d26b31d994
Depends-On: I28ea18badcb4a47daece5efed38d53fc35870902
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/36/222536/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set the IP address that Sheepdog running on sheepdog_store_address = 127.0.0.1 # Set the port listening on
deleted_lines: sheepdog_store_address = localhost

commit_message:
Revert "Remove requests to example.com during unit testing"

This reverts commit 21d5657640359d6b545d87252cc383e73f6b9a1c.

This patch removed image iterator tests rather than urllib tests like
claimed.

Change-Id: If3ca5e31b2b9456c4790efc513dc2b9f02ee3660

commit_message:
Glance metadata definition i18n support needed

The Glance Metadata Definitions (metadefs) need to be able to display
the display-name, titles and descriptions for Namespaces, Objects and
Properties in alternate languages.

Change-Id: I26b9ae7805f7fa8dfdba1d3559bbf8d450ff0824
Implements: blueprint metadefs-i18n-support

subject: Tighten up testing for sloppy auth version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 14:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/a0d65e4ccddffbf2b1596332ef67733583554bbc', 'message': 'Tighten up testing for sloppy auth version

The existing test that os-identity-api-version=2 would
result in the correct auth_version=2.0 (note 2 -> 2.0)
does not verify the sloppy version handling code path.
When auth, key and user options are all missing the
auth version is always set to 2.0 so the test will always
pass. Adding auth, key and user options to the test command
will cause the test to verify that the os-identity-api-version
option was used and mapped to 2.0.

Change-Id: Ifa10cd2b8bf81c082d5e3fa846f993871194fea0
'}]
commit_message:
Tighten up testing for sloppy auth version

The existing test that os-identity-api-version=2 would
result in the correct auth_version=2.0 (note 2 -> 2.0)
does not verify the sloppy version handling code path.
When auth, key and user options are all missing the
auth version is always set to 2.0 so the test will always
pass. Adding auth, key and user options to the test command
will cause the test to verify that the os-identity-api-version
option was used and mapped to 2.0.

Change-Id: Ifa10cd2b8bf81c082d5e3fa846f993871194fea0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/98/312998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # check os_identity_api_version=3.0 is mapped to auth_version=3 # check os_identity_api_version=2 is mapped to auth_version=2.0 # A somewhat contrived scenario - we need to pass in the v1 style opts # to prevent auth version defaulting to 2.0 due to lack of v1 style # options. That way we can actually verify that the sloppy 2 was # interpreted and mapped to 2.0 opts = {"key": "secret", "user": "user", "auth": "http://example.com:5000/v2.0"} args = _make_args("stat", opts, os_opts, '-')
deleted_lines: # check os_identity_api_version is sufficient in place of auth_version # check os_identity_api_version is sufficient in place of auth_version args = _make_args("stat", {}, os_opts, '-')

commit_message:
VMware: Unit test refactoring

There are unit tests which test multiple code paths and methods.
This patch refactors the unit tests for the following methods in
the vmdk module to fix this:
* copy_volume_to_image
* _in_use
* retype

Change-Id: I8b86896e90a89d0c60f54c6b2a9ea3eda1841e9b
